entry.dcterms:title: The Socio-Economic Status of Parents and the Gender Ratio of Their Children in Hungary 1999
entry.dcterms:creator: Dávid, Kriszta
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F81: The Socio-Economic Status of Parents and the Gender Ratio of Their Children in Hungary 1999. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19
entry.dcterms:creator: Hüse, Lajos
entry.dcterms:contributor: University of Debrecen College Department of Health
University of Debrecen College Department of Health
entry.dcterms:description: social characteritics that might have influenced the birth parameters of newborn babies; looked for social factors to which the individual gives biological reactions; gathered data about the status-dependent development of three main child parameters, these were body weight and body length (they are unambiguously dependent on the environment)and sex ratios, which in theory develops as a result of statisctically random factor
entry.dcterms:subject: demography
family life, marriage, relationship
gender and gender roles
person
survey data
cross-section
A non-representative sample of mothers taking care of their newborn babies in the small and middle-size settlements of Szabolcs-Szatmár-Bereg county.
face-to-face interview
D (after 2008-08-01: A)
